11112.content:
Sonic and co. were still stuck on Earth. Eggman hadn't done much lately, and nothing else has been really happening. As a result, Sonic had been so bored, and so lazy, that he had actually started gaining weight. Mr. Tenaka had been forced to send more food to him everyday.

Outside, Tails and Cream were playing catch. Happily the children cheered, until Cheese accidentally hit the ball halfway across the yard.
"I'l' get it" Cream said running to the other side of the house. Turning around the corner, she saw the ball. But, as she ran up to it, she accidentally bumped into someone.

Getting backk off the gound, she saw that it was Sonic.
He weighed 315lb. He had a massive squishy belly, bigger and fatter arms and legs, a plumpened bigger rear, and he was even starting to get man breasts.
"Oh sorry Sonic" Cream said. The hedgehog finished a drum stick he was eating, and tossed the bone away. However, his tummy still growled.

"Ooooh, I don't believe this" Sonic moaned. "What's wrong Sonic ?" Cream asked innocently. "It seems like no matter how much I eat, I still need a little...more ?" he said looking back at Cream.
"So your tummy wants food, I could go get you some" Cream said picking up the ball.
Sonic put his hand on her shoulder "Actually, I think I just found something".

His stomach growled, He lifted Cream up, She screamed, and the ball dropped to the ground.

Tails finally came around and found the ball. Then he saw him "Hey Sonic, have you seen Cream ?". "Nope, sorry buddy" he answered. Tails just went back to looking.
Sonic then patted his gut, which squirmed and screamed. "Looks like I'm finally full, and Tails didn't even notice, I knew this gut would come in handy one day" he said continuing to rub his belly.

The SUV that the Sonic Underground had drived across the vast desert. Sonia was in the back. The van had been divided into a private room in the back, which Sonia was sleeping in. He and Manic were in the front seats.

"You're holding it upside down, you idiot!" Sonic said flipping it around.
"Oh. That explains alot." Manic said.
Sonic sighed and headed to the back of the van. He could get some sleep. When he was in the back, his stomach growled louder than ever before. "So hungry." he said. He thought about where he could get food from. He then looked at Sonia and came up with an idea. He remembered hearing that each medallion had three wishes. He held the medallion with a hand close to his heart and said, "I wish I could swallow others whole." He suddenly felt pain all over hsi body. Sonic would eat Sonia. That wouldn't be too hard. He walked over to her bed and smiled. He grabbed her feet and opened his mouth. He slid them in. In case she woke up, he didn't want her to use those. He swallowed again, bringing in her chest. Even if she woke up, she would have a hard time getting out. The throat was pulling her in and her legs were in his stomach.
'Not long now.' Sonic thought. He swallowed again, leaving only her head outside his mouth. Her eyes opened suddenly and she screamed. She couldn't believe her own brother was eating her.
"Don't do it, Son. . ." was all she said before her head was engulfed. Sonic waited a few seconds before swallowing again, pushing her head into his throat. He smiled. His neck bulged out greatly for a half a minute before the bulge in it went down and dissapeared into his chest. His gut swelled greatly and he had to sit down. He rubbed his belly.
"You were great sis!" Sonic said.
"Sonic let me out, please!" was what he could make out from the muffled voice.
"Nope. I needed food, amd you had the unfortunate luck of being nearby." Sonic said. He didn't notice that while he was eating Sonia that. . .

11122.content:
(I'mma also make this Archie, post reboot, with some elements from the pre-reboot world preserved (mainly characters that were taken out).)

Sonic was doing his favorite activity - running. A good thousand mile dash was an excellent way to relax after saving the world. And with the Dark Gaia defeated, everything was piecing itself back together again. The world was restored, and even Nicole and the Sky Patrol were back in action.

Granted, Eggman was still in power, and his Egg Bosses still ruled their regions with iron fists (although in the cases of some, it was more of a velvet glove), and there were still other villains around. Breezie with her iron control over Casinopolis AND most of the world's media. Walter Naugus, the Ixis mage, was out there. The mad Dr. Finitevus was conducting his experiments still. Scourge and the other evil twins. Fiona and the Destructix. And there was that strange lost world in the sky that had been appearing recently. He got a bad feeling whenever he looked at it.

He sighed, skidding to a halt. He didn't know it, but he'd stopped in an area where the barrier 'between' was thin. Crystals dotted the landscape, glowing lights flitting around like bugs.

"It's not fair," Sonic muttered. "No matter how much we do, there's always someone out there waiting to swallow up everyone's hopes. I wish I could show them all what it's like to be swallowed up..."

Shaking his head, Sonic ran off. He never realized until it was too late that something heard his wish, and misinterpreted it...

111223.content:
The device was greatly advanced. From a future far beyond even Silver's time, it had come to the past, searching for a purpose. A nanotech supermachine of incredible power and almost reality-warping ability to alter his surroundings. But there was one problem - Its AI was stupid. It misunderstood things at times, and tended to cause trouble. Usually while trying to help, which is what it believed its function was.

Case in point - Sonic's frustrated statement.

It thought Sonic wanted to LITERALLY swallow people up. So it affixed itself to the hedgehog, altering his body and body chemistry. It made him capable of swallowing and digesting ANYTHING whole, his digestive tract impervious to all harm. It also increased his appetite, and made it so that he would find living things delicious.

Wish granted! the machine thought erroneously. What a good thing it had done!

113222212121.content:
Darkness.

His life, was darkness and pain. Ever since his defeat by Sonic and that damned ...wolf? For some reason, he kept seeing different creatures whenever he tried to remember him. No matter. Ever since his defeat, Eggman had been using him as a slave power source to his machines. He could barely remember who he was, barely remember that he existed.

All he knew was that he wanted revenge. On EVERYTHING.

One day, he became vaguely aware of a fight brewing between Sonic and Eggman. Trapped within the machine, he couldn't call out. He prayed they both destroyed each other, or at least destroyed the machine so he could just die. Instead, something else happened.

He was freed.

Eggman stared at Infinite as he collapsed to the ground. "Oooooh crap..."

"Was wondering what happened to you," Sonic said. "Geez, Eggman. Harsh punishment much?"

Infinite growled. "Hate... HATE..." he said, slowly picking himself up.

"Easy, Infinite," Sonic said, trying to placate him. "I know you're mad at Eggy for putting you in that machine like you were a Duracell or something, but..."

"Hate... you ALL!" Infinite declared. He felt his power returning rapidly. Sonic backed away, nervous. Eggman had already fled, and Infinite, when he was calmer, would later acknowledge the doctor's intelligence.

Infinite screamed, the power of the Phantom Ruby radiating around him. His mask, broken from the muzzle down, glowed as he channeled all his hatred and fury into it, wanting to tear Sonic... Light blinded him. And when the light returned, everything was different. He found himself in a jungle, far from civilizaiton. He reached out with the powers of the Phantom Ruby... things felt oddly different. As if several different continuities had been smushed together.

The words 'pre-reboot Archie, post-reboot Archie, IDW, Boom, game universes combined' flashed through his head. Nonsense phrases that had no meaning to him, although he felt that each nonsense phrase meant a different reality. "Five... no, six realities merged into one... Did I do this?"

He reached out with his powers again, powers that had seemingly expanded beyond anything he'd ever had before. He felt that everyone in each reality... believed that it had always been this way. All the realms, each merged into one. Infinite stroked his chin thoughtfully, considering this... and decided it didn't matter.

"No matter how many universes are combined, every last person in it will feel my wrath. Sonic, Eggman, all their allies, even incidental people, I will unleash my Infinite fury on them both!" Infinite declared. A vicious laugh escaped him as he flew off into the distance to make his next move.

Sally wanders closer, the sent of meat cooking on the fire, smelling like fresh cheese to a baby mouse. Her pace slows causiously as she becomes more aware of the strange figure sitting beside the dancing flames.

Even while sitting, she could tell that he was tall, toned, and gracefully slim. His silloette spoke of angular feline features, but also of something unearthly.

"Come, come little one . . . " he coaxed with a English/French noble's air, "don't stand there hungry in the cold."
He motioned to a seat across from him as he continued to turn a spit . . . that was loaded with numerous specimens of wild meat, all sizzling musically over the dancing fires.

Sally's stomach growled ravenously, but her common since for danger held her back.

"heheh," he chuckled warmly, sounding more and more like an uncle and less like a threat, "now, now Sally. Don't just stand there like a lost pup. Come and join me."

"How do you know my name?!" She asks in surprise as she inches closer to the stranger.

He just smiles gently, "Oh, I know every single soul on Mobeus, though . . ." he waves his free hand and conjures up a warm blanket up on the ajacent log for her to sit on, "most only know me through their dreams."

Sally finally sat down, her eyes dancing over the stranger's features now that they were bathed in the light instead hidden by it. His face was definately feline, but his ears and eyes were angled like a creature from a fairytale. He wore a traveler's cloak over a regal gentleman's garb . . . like a noble of old who had just stepped out for an evening jaunt.

He continued to smile and speak warmly, not minding her quizical and weary examination. "Some call me a wizard, others a demon, and a number even think of me as a saint." He began cutting the different meats into fritter size peices as he continued, Sally now captivated by his almost hypnotic voice. "I can sense people's thoughts, feel their dreams, detect their deepest desires . . . the very feelings that they keep to themselves and fear sharing with the world."

Sally flinched at that statement, but it was too late to hide it from his eyes. "So you know . . . "

"About the dream you've had . . .," he just gave her that big uncle smile as he began filling a plate with cuts. "Yes. A rather interesting one."

"Interesting?!" Sally practically shouted, "How can anybody think devouring one's friends . . . let alone enjoying it . . . is interesting!?"

The stranger hardly even twitched at the outburst, he just kept fixing the plate and laughing it off. "Hahahaha, indeed. What "rational" person would? And yet you can't put it out of your mind, nore ignore the feelings it's stirred in you." He hands her the heavily loaded plate, which she absidmindedly excepts. "Most 'rational' minds would think your dreams are the twisted results of hunger and a lack of meat. What with all the destruction the "good doctor's" robots cause and how the increased security on the Robotropolis warehouses have made it nye impossible to aquire proper food supplies. And a psychiatrist would think they are the results of dormant predatorial genes inherant in all Mobians from long ago being stirred by the hunger. The very same factors that lead to cannibalism in any sentiant species."

He poured a mug of warm cider for each of them before continuing, Sally's mind focused on this stranger's words while her hands were busy with the plate he'd given her.

"But I know this to be just intellectual sugar coating." he shakes his head with a laugh, "I can tell when something is merely primal instincts . . . and when it's true primal desire."

Sally almost dropped her plate and mug in protest, but he help up his gloved hand and she held herself as he proceeded. "I make it my purpose in life to find poor souls with such desires and . . . help them fullfill them. I can use my magic and powers to temperally warp reality in order to help my discovered "playmates" realize any and every pleasure, lust, and desire they have buried in them so they no longer have to feel tortured by them or being afraid of them. When I feel their needs have been properly filled, I reset everything back to normal so that it all appears to have been nothing but a very full-filling dream."

Sally's eye's widened at this . . . "So you've lured me out here to offer me such help?"

He smiles . . .
